channel.title: Galleries on Nikolai Nekrutenko
channel.description: Recent content in Galleries on Nikolai Nekrutenko

item.title: Ice Storm Pt. 2
item.description: I’ve had enough sitting at home, not leaving my neighborhood for a week. So, I ventured out to Jo Hays Vista with my newly built FPV freestyle drone and camera at my side. Unfortunately I forgot to charge the FPV goggles before hand, so the drone was practically useless. I’m still glad I saw the harsh, wind-chiseled ice. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !

item.title: Ice Storm
item.description: A massive ice storm just passed by State College. So while most people were scared of slipping and breaking an arm, I decided to venture out into the neighborhood and nearby golf course with my macro 35mm lens. I find the texture of the ice fascinating—it resembles a network of plant cells, or looks like some carbonated drink. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !

item.title: Phone Flashlight Photography
item.description: It’s been a while since I did something overly creative, like drawing circles with fire. So, here’s a remedy to that! These were made by leaving the shutter open for a few seconds (30) and using my phone’s flashlight to draw while the sensor gathered light. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 35mm f/20 30sec ISO 200"

item.title: Stonevalley
item.description: Explored the areas around the frozen Lake Perez—where I used to sail in the summer—one of my favorite places of all time. I also attempted the tilt-shift effect in Photoshop from a nearby overlook of State College. I think the house turned out the best! .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 400mm f/10 1/400sec ISO 100"

item.title: Snow
item.description: Happy New Year! A major snowstorm recently unleashed its wrath on us, for a grand total of 14in or 35cm of fluffy, dry snow! Here are some of my favorite long exposures from the evening. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 35mm f/14 30sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.6 1.3sec ISO 100"

item.title: Snow - Aftermath
item.description: It was one of those fictional, silent winter mornings 14in or 35cm of fluffy, dry snow had just finished precipitating .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 35mm f/5.6 0.0012499999720592975sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.6 1/1000sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.6 1/500sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.

item.title: Flying RC Jets!
item.description: Here are some pictures of my friends over at @teamsketchyfpv flying some of their planes. Thanks to them for inviting me, I had an absolute blast. Looks like it’s time for me to get an RC jet! And yes, we did keep at least six feet apart. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 135mm f/5.

item.title: The Mostly Maine Trip
item.description: I recently went on a camping/cabining trip with my family around New England, especially Maine. I know there are a lot of photographs, but I really like all of these. .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 400mm f/5.6 1/60sec ISO 4000" 100mm f/4.5 1/60sec ISO 250" 35mm f/4.

item.title: Around the Garden
item.description: I walked around the garden and garage to see what pictures I could take. Here are the ones that I liked: .jg-entry img { transition: transform .25s ease-in-out !important; } .jg-entry img:hover { transform: scale(1.1); } 35mm f/5.6 0.001249999972058798sec ISO 100" 35mm f/6.300000190736682 1/200sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.6 1/320sec ISO 100" 35mm f/5.

item.title: Vacuum Tube Amplifier
item.description: Last night, I was listening to music on a vacuum tube amplifier that I assembled a while back from a kit. I really liked the look of the tubes in dark, they had a very retro aesthetic. Since they glowed in a very gentle orange-red color, they were perfect for a long exposure. Maybe it has to do with the look of these tubes, but I’m convinced that music sounds better on tubes than on a transistor amp.

item.title: Water Lilies & Dragonflies
item.description: Today, I headed down to The Arboretum at Penn State to see what flowers and insects were in store for me. At first, I decided to bring a 35mm macro lens. However, after seeing all of the dragonflies and lilies, I biked home in record time and snagged a telephoto lens. I present to you the Water lilies and Dragonflies at The Arboretum at Penn State. .

item.title: Solstice Fun
item.description: I went camping with my family in the beautiful Northern PA countryside, near the finger lakes. To celebrate the longest day of the year, I found a stick about my height and lit both ends of it on fire. It was similar to the staff that I use in Tang Soo Do, so I messed around with various techniques. Particularly, I really enjoy doing the figure-eight technique where you essentially spin the stick in the shape of an infinity sign.
